div.l: Ley doun̄ thy swerd and I woll myn̄ alswa
I is full wight god wote as is a raa
By goddes hert he shall nat skape vs bath
Why ne had þᵘou put the Caple in the lath
Yll hayle / by god Aleyn̄ þᵘou is a fonne
Thise sely clerkes han̄ ful fast yronne
Toward the fen̄ both Aleyn̄ and Iohn
And whan þe myller sawe þᵗat þey were gon
He half a busshell of her͗e flour͗e hath take
And bade his wyf go knede it in a kake
He seid I trowe þe clerkes ben̄ aferd
Yitte can̄ a Miller make a clerkes bord
Ye for all his art ye let hem go her wey
Lo where þey go / ye let þe children̄ pley
They gete hym nat so lightly by my croun̄
Thise sely clerkes rennen̄ vp and doun̄
Wᵗith kepe here / stand stand / Iossa wartherere
Ga whistle þᵘou and I shall kepe hym here
But shortly till it was v̉erray nyght
They coude nat þough þey did all her myght
Her caple cacche / he ran̄ all wey so fast
Tyll in a dyche they caught hym at þe last
Wery and wete as beest is in þe reyn̄
Comth sely Iohn and wᵗith hym comth Aleyn̄
Allas koth Iohn þat day that I was born̄
Now ar we dryuen̄ till hethyng and to scorn̄
Our͗e corn̄ is stole men woll vs fonnes call
Both the wardeins and our felawes all
And namely þe Myller wele awey
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he goth by þe wey
Toward þe myll and bayard in his honde
The myller sittyng by þe fire he fonde
For it was nyght and ferther myght þey nought
But for the love of god þey hym besought
Of herber and of ese as for her penye
The myller seid agayn̄ yf here be enye
Soch as it is yitte shall ye haue your ꝑpart
Myn̄ hous is streite but yᵉe han̄ lerned art
Ye can̄ by argumentes make a place
A myle brode of xxᵗⁱ · fote of space
Let se now or this place woll suffise
